content.raw: I just removed my approval because something else occurred to me. You copied what is done with ODE, but I think that can be improved. If you give the parameter a more distinct name, `solver_type` instead of `type`, then the gazebo `PresetManager` from [pull request 1471](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1471/presetmanager-for-physics-library/diff) will call `PhysicsEngine::SetParam("solver_type")`. So it's a little more verbose, but there is a small advantage to naming the variable `solver_type` I think.

If you give the parameter a more distinct name, solver_type instead of type, then the gazebo PresetManager from pull request 1471 will call PhysicsEngine::SetParam("solver_type"). So it's a little more verbose, but there is a small advantage to naming the variable solver_type I think.
